subtitle: Not only does this dish look superb it is a fantastic alternative to the traditional apple pie.

method.text: Using an apple corer, remove the apple cores. Brush the insides of the apple with the lemon juice to help prevent discolouration.
In a bowl, mix together the cherries, apricots, dates and sugar. Set aside.
Divide the pastry into individual portions. Roll each piece out to a round big enough to totally wrap the apples in, using a saucer to cut around if necessary.
Place the apples in the centre of each round of pastry. Fill the centre of each apple with the fruit filling mixture, packing it in tightly.
Brush the edges of the pastry rounds with water. Carefully bring up around the apple so that each is totally encased. Press the edges together to form a seam and seal.
Transfer the pastry wrapped apples to a lightly greased baking tray with the join underneath. Use any trimmings to make into leaves to decorate the apples.

Using a little cold water to attach, decorate the tops with the pastry leaves. Brush all over with the egg white. Sprinkle with the caster sugar. Cook in the oven for 30-35 min or until crisp and golden. Serve immediately.

title: Pastry wrapped stuffed apples
